The athlete is cheered,
the artist admired.
The genius is honored,
the mixer desired.
The musician is followed,
the rebel revered.
The pretty is chased,
the bully is feared.
The lonely go unseen,
the broken are lost.
The skills she has learned
are those she has bought.
To spend what she owns
from a bank that is small,
is too big an expense
to risk a big fall.
She spends each day planning
how to hide in a crowd.
She avoids all attention
lest she be pointed out. When she quietly speaks up
and just asks for a hand,
those that dismissed her
dismiss her again.
She suffers in solitude,
not invited to dance.
She fast-forwards her life
and considers that chance.
Each word of hope
and request to spend time,
infuses within her
more strength for the climb.
The skills she now lacks
can only be learned,
when the safety of loved ones
is there at each turn. Were it not for the few
that hear her whispers and pleas,
the Invisible Child
would never be seen----s.sprinkle 8/18
